name: spreadsheetAddRows
syntax: spreadsheetAddRows(spreadsheetObj, data,[ row, column , insert, datatype, includeColumnNames])
description: Adds multiple rows from a query or array to an Excel spreadsheet object.

params.name: row
params.description: The row number in the spreadsheet at which to insert the data. If omitted rows are appended.

params.name: column
params.description: The column number to start, all columns to the left will be empty.

params.name: insert
params.description: When true appends the row `data` to the `spreadsheetObj`. When `false` attempts to update the spreadsheet object rows.

params.name: datatype
params.description: CF11+ An array of datatype expressions with values `STRING` `NUMERIC` or `DATE`. For example use `DATE:1;NUMERIC:2-2;STRING

params.name: includeColumnNames
params.description: CF2016+ When `true` writes column names as headers in the spreadsheet.

examples.title: Adding rows to a spreadsheet from a Query
examples.code:
<cfset q = queryNew("name,beers",
    "varchar,integer",
    [ {"name":"John","beers":2}, {"name":"Pete","beers":1} ])> 

<!--- Make a spreadsheet object ---> 
<cfset s = spreadsheetNew()> 
<!--- Add header row ---> 
<cfset spreadsheetAddRow(s, "Name,Beers")> 
<!--- Add query ---> 
<cfset spreadsheetAddRows(s, q)> 
<cfdump var="#s#" />

examples.title: CF2016: Adding rows to a spreadsheet from a Query using column names as headers
examples.description: You need to state the row, column, insert and datatype variables before you can change includeColumnNames to true as ACF internal functiosn don't allow named arguments.
examples.code:
<cfset q = queryNew("name,beers",
    "varchar,integer",
    [ {"name":"John","beers":2}, {"name":"Pete","beers":1} ])> 

<!--- Make a spreadsheet object ---> 
<cfset s = spreadsheetNew()> 
<!--- Add query and preserve column names ---> 
<cfset spreadsheetAddrows(s,q,1,1,true,[
